prompt: <description>**Part 1: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism** The first part of the CAD assembly is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The height is approximately twice the width, and the length of the shorter side is about half the length of the longer side. To construct this part, start by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: coordinate\\_system: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] Next, create the 2D sketch for this part on the plane defined by the coordinate system. The sketch consists of a single face (face\\_1) with a closed loop (loop\\_1) made up of three lines. sketch: - face\\_1: - loop\\_1: - line\\_1:Start Point: [0.0, 0.0], End Point: [0.75, 0.1555] - line\\_2:Start Point: [0.75, 0.1555], End Point: [0.5723, 0.4926] - line\\_3:Start Point: [0.5723, 0.4926], End Point: [0.0, 0.0] Now, scale the 2D sketch using the scaling parameter: sketch\\_scale: 0.75 Next, transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector. In this case, the euler angles are all 0, and the translation vector is also [0, 0, 0]. Transform the 2D sketch using these properties: coordinate\\_system: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] Finally, extrude the 3D sketch to generate the part using the following properties: extrusion: - extrude\\_depth\\_towards\\_normal: 0.2103 - extrude\\_depth\\_opposite\\_normal: 0.0 - operation: Create a new solid body This completes the instructions for constructing the first part of the CAD assembly. The resulting part will be a three-dimensional rectangular prism with the specified dimensions.</description>
